wikipedia_page.main: William Lennie (c. 1779–1852) was a Scottish grammarian. He was the author of textbooks on English grammar, including The Principles of English Grammar, which became a widely used textbook in British and American schools.

response: For the grammarian, see William Lennie.

Bullions revised The Principles of English Grammar by William Lennie, another Scottish grammarian, in the 1830s. In the 1840s and 1850s, he wrote his own textbooks on English, Latin and Greek grammar. He also authored commentaries on Julius Caesar's Commentarii de Bello Gallico.
